alert.note: Alert for Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:47PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Rock Island, east central Cedar, Scott, northeastern Muscatine and southwestern Clinton Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1146 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wheatland, or 13 miles north of Durant, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Calamus around 1150 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Donahue, Walcott, Long Grove, Davenport, Eldridge and Bettendorf. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa near mile marker 1. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 281 and 299. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
